required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hypermethylation of VTRNA2-1 Promoter in HCC Outcome
clinical_study.official_title: Differential Hypermethylation Status of the VTRNA2-1 Promoter in Hepatocellular Carcinoma as an Independent Factor After Partial Hepatectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The clinic-pathological data were retrieved from the cancer registry database from the Cancer Center of Chang Gung Memorial Hospital, Linkou branch. Of the 92 HCC patients with partial hepatectomies enrolled. The biological specimen was studied with approval.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was approved by the Institute Review Board (IRB) of Chang Gung Memorial Hospital, Linkou Branch (IRB 201801969B0). The clinic-pathological data were retrieved from the cancer registry database from the Cancer Center of Chang Gung Memorial Hospital, Linkou branch. Of the 92 HCC patients with partial hepatectomies enrolled, all patients had curative hepatectomy and those with different cancers were excluded. HCC tumor tissue and normal tissue, 3 cm from the tumor margin, were stored immediately in a -80 degree freezer at the Central Biobank of Chang Gung Memorial Hospital. The personal information was protected with decoding and registered with number.

primary_outcome.description: The length of time from curative hepatectomies treatment and recurrence or mortality

secondary_outcome.description: The length of time from hepatectomies treatment for HCC and still alive.

arm_group.description: The hypermethylation group was defined as differential methylation status of tumor- normal â‰¥ 5%.
The hypomethylation were defined as differential methylation status of tumor- normal <5%

biospec_descr.textblock: frozen specimen of tumor and normal parts at Central Biobank of Chang Gung Memorial Hospital

study_pop.textblock: HCC patients with curative partial hepatectomies and the pathology reports proved.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
subjects with pathologic diagnosis of hepatocellular carcinoma curative partial hepatectomies
Exclusion Criteria:
history of different malignant disease. subjects cannot be treated with curative surgery.
